thread.title: Five things to do in Springfield, Oct. 9-10
thread.title_full: Five things to do in Springfield, Oct. 9-10

author: Staff report
title: Five things to do in Springfield, Oct. 9-10
text: Posted Oct. 7, 2015 at 10:30 PM By Staff report Posted Oct. 7, 2015 at 10:30 PM Oct. 9 “Sinking Feeling” exhibition opening: 6-8:30 p.m., DEMO Project, 732 N. Fourth St. Opening reception for the group exhibit featuring works from Central Illinois-based contemporary artists. “Sinking Feeling” runs through Oct. 31. Free. demoprojectspace.com . Lakota Sioux Dance Theatre, “Come to the Center”: 7 p.m., Sangamon Auditorium, University of Illinois Springfield. $40/$21. 206-6160, sangamonauditorium.org . End Time Trio (concert): 7:30-9:30 p.m., Terra Andes, 411 E. Washington St. The jazz/freestyle ensemble will create two sets of sound sculpture for anyone interested in uneasy listening and musical provocation. Suggested donation of $5. Food and drinks will be available. 698-9367, on.fb.me/1JGpMMH . Oct. 9-10 Portuguese Rodeo Clown Company (comedy): 8 p.m., Hoogland Center for the Arts, 420 S. Sixth St. $15. The Portuguese Rodeo Clown Company will perform improv comedy. hcfta.org . Oct. 10 Boo Bark, Party at the Park: 11 a.m. to 2 p.m., Stuart Park. The city’s only Halloween party for dogs. Vendors, special activities for dogs, a costume contests and more. The first 100 attendees will receive a special treat bag. $3 for one dog, $5 for two dogs to attend (no more than two dogs per person). All proceeds benefit APL’s homeless cats and dogs. apl-shelter.org; dbonner@apl-shelter.org. By Staff report
